total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the different regions in the grid, where a region is a group of cells with the same color that are connected through their edges.
Q2: Determine the order of the regions from the top left to the bottom right of the grid.
Q3: Remove the outermost region (which is the largest region) from the grid.
Q4: For each remaining region, determine its position in the original grid.
Q5: Create a new grid with the same number of rows as the number of remaining regions and the same number of columns as the maximum width of these regions.
Q6: Place each region in the new grid according to its position in the original grid, filling the rest of the cells with the color of the outermost region.

Q1: Identify the different regions in the grid by their color codes.
Q2: Determine the boundaries of each region.
Q3: Identify the smallest rectangle that can contain each region.
Q4: Crop the grid to only include the rectangles identified in Q3.
Q5: Arrange the cropped regions from top to bottom based on their position in the original grid.
Q6: If there are multiple regions in the same row, arrange them from left to right based on their position in the original grid.
